wiki.text:
'Motivation' is a psychological feature that arouses an organism to act towards
a desired goal and elicits, controls, and sustains certain goal-directed
behaviors. It can be considered a driving force; a psychological one that
compels or reinforces an action toward a desired goal. For example, hunger is a
motivation that elicits a desire to eat. Motivation is the purpose or
psychological cause of an action.<ref></ref>

Motivation has been shown to have roots in physiological, behavioral, cognitive,
and social areas. Motivation may be rooted in a basic impulse to optimize well-
being, minimize physical pain and maximize pleasure. It can also originate from
specific physical needs such as eating, sleeping or resting, and sex.

Motivation is an inner drive to behave or act in a certain manner. "It's the
difference between waking up before dawn to pound the pavement and lazing around
the house all day."<ref>[http://www.psychologytoday.com/basics/motivation]</ref>
These inner conditions such as wishes, desires, goals, activate to move in a
particular direction in behavior.
